Literature Review: The role of zoos and aquariums in a changing world has evolved significantly over the years. As institutions that have been around for centuries, they have had to adapt to the changing needs of society and the environment. In recent years, there has been a growing recognition of the importance of zoos and aquariums in contributing to biodiversity conservation, environmental education, and scientific research. However, this shift has also led to increased criticism regarding the outcomes of their actions and the holding of species in their facilities. This review aims to provide an integrated analysis of the state of knowledge about the role that zoos and aquariums play today, highlighting their performance regarding their conservation, education, and research functions, as well as the challenges they face in meeting the growing social and environmental expectations.
